title: Having trouble installing Thunderbird on new machine
content:
We just got a new computer because the previous computer died. I downloaded and installed Thunderbird on the new machine, which has Windows 11. I entered my name, email bcde@nc.rr.com and password. It had IMAP configuration on the screen and when I clicked 'Done', it gave me the error "Unable to log in at server. Probably wrong configuration, username or password." When I tried changing it to POP and clicked "Done", I got the same error.

There is a 'configure manually' link, but I do not know how to do that. Please let me know what I should do.

Thanks,

Bruce Elsheimer bcde@nc.rr.com
creator: bcde

title: icloud emailaddress ad to Thunderbird
content: Hello, This morning I did try to ad my iCloud email address account to Thunderbird. I already got an email account in Thunderbird but that will stop within a few months. I did find the needed information on my iPhone: My name for the use off capital and lowercase letters; my iCloud email address; my password which is my Apple ID, I presume. The result is: 'It is not possible to log in to the server. Probably an incorrect configuration, username or password'. The username and password are correct (got it from my iPhone, and the mailserver iCloud does work perfect on my iCloud mailprogram (iPhone, iPad, PC). So maybe the configuration, see appendix, isn't ok but I did get that from Thunderbird. Do I overlook something? Thanks for helping.
creator: brtdkstr

title: tb115 I widened the message list too far right edge.  Lost the right pane.  How to restore?
content:
I was exploring this new 115 of Thunderbird and ended up wiping the message viewer off the screen.

To start with, I have my TBird 115 as it came "out of the box." Three columns, Inbox folder tree on the left, Cards List in the center, and message pane in the right side.

I messed everything up when I widened the Cards list to the right edge of the window, where the <---> arrowhead disappeared and all there is to the right side is the window resize arrow from my Linux system and that awful slim Jim scroll bar.

I recovered my message pane using F8 key; it is below my short list of email in the Cards View. See the attached screenshot.

I would like to return things back to as they were with the three columns as described above. I forgot, too, where I turned on Classic View. There is a checked box in Settings somewhere. Or is it a menu? I need some help, please.

May I suggest a limit somewhere short of the right-side edge of the window and short of the scroll bar to only widen the message pane "so far," such that one can recover from pushing it that far, using the same means to return it with the double arrow.

OS: Linux Mint 21.3 Cinnamon Thunderbird 115 MintBox Mini 2 Pro computer
creator: FirefoxinUbuntu

title: How to trigger Thunderbird to repair ALL folders
content:
Question: How do I trigger Thunderbird to run the equivalent of the "Repair Folder" option (Folder Properties, Repair Folder) on ALL folders under an account?

Background: After a recent unexpected system reboot (with Thunderbird running), I have dozens of folders that Thunderbird will not move messages to on receipt. (Although applying filters to all messages in the folder appear to move the messages, but I do not see an update to an affected folder to which a message was moved.) In order to move and see the messages in the affected target folder(s) I currently have to find that each folder, right click, select "Properties", then click "Repair Folder". There does not seem to be rhyme or reason to which folders, and I do not know which are affected until a message comes in that should be moved to that folder. Due to the number of folders I have, the logical thing would be to trigger "Repair Folder" on all folders.

(Yes, I have searched, and I have read "How do I repair ALL forlders?" (https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1390491 , posted 2022-09-24), but the response(s) to that post did not answer the question.)

Thanks in advance for any guidance/direction you may be able to provide.
creator: acroft

title: I DO NOT want Mozilla Thunderbird Email to: Read, compose, send, and permanently delete all my email from Gmail
content:
How many times per day, and over a period of how many years, will it be necessary to tell Mozilla Thunderbird Email that I DO NOT want Mozilla Thunderbird Email to:

Read, compose, send, and permanently delete all my email from Gmail

BEFORE THEY WILL STOP ASKING?
creator: JohnPerna

title: Server issue? Bounce from zero inbox to full inbox…
content:
Good afternoon,

I usually read my emails in Thunderbird on my MacBook Pro or via the standard mail app on my iPhone. In addition, I have been experiencing the problem day in and day out for years now that once I have checked my email, read it and distributed it in an organized manner across my email accounts and folders, towards an empty inbox again… unfortunately I can start all over again a little later because the emails then jump back to the inbox... usually this occurs a few times. You can imagine that this takes me a lot of unnecessary energy. Do you have any possible advice or solution? That would be such a relief! Looking forward to it!

Best regards, Inge
creator: i.c.veldman

title: Email stops downloading
content: Once a month, some of my accounts stop downloading messages, then magically returns to normal after three days. This has been going on consistently every month for about 5 months now, I can still send messages. I can only get my messages if I go to the AOL server. AOL claims it is not their problem because the messages can be seen on the server and it is the third party mail apps where the problem is. Thing is, it happens to all of my devices with different apps at the same time. Thunderbird on windows, Gmail on Andriod, and the mail app on iOS. This does not happen to all of our accounts, just the same one or two every month. They want me to purchase a service plan. Any idea of what is going on?
creator: jdonbiz

title: Need to change from POP3 to Imap for server setting
content: I recently installed Tunderbird on my laptop for my appraisal business. It loaded the server settings to POP3 instead of IMAP. I am tring to convert it over to IMAP.
creator: otrappraisal

title: Retrieving Old Google Mail
content:
While a long-time user of Thunderbird, I only discovered a few months ago that I could successfully front-end my GMail account. For several decades I collected and collated all my mail from the several different POP servers I've used, but did not know that Thunderbird could treat the IMAP-based Google mail server as if POP.

So, for the past several months, I have been very, very happy to have my GMail recent email traffic integrated with the others.

What I have not discovered how to accomplish is the retrieval of a trove of some rather important emails exchanged and retained on the GMail server from about 2012 through 2021. I know that I could forward those emails to one of my other POP accounts and they would be sent to my Thunderbird front end as newly-arrived emails and I will do that if there is no way to achieve what I would actually like to achieve which would be the ability to coerce the server and client into treating the old emails as fresh, so that I could receive and catalog them without the distorted history that would appertain by forwarding them -- showing up as forwarded from rather than sent from the original parties and carrying a modern date rather than the historically-correct one.

Coercing the server side into restoring the old emails to an UnRead state does not have the desired effect. Any suggestion from anyone who has faced a similar conundrum and solved it would be much appreciated.
creator: Terry.Corbet

title: TB seems corrupted or has a bug
content:
I am having trouble with my email account. After I tag an email, Thunderbird does not stay at that email but jumps to another arbitrary email above where I was working. It's really annoying to have to keep scrolling to find the email I was working on. It's more than this but this is the basic problem I need to fix now.

The second issue is the program seems corrupted as it is acting very wonky. It will jump to drafts when I am in my inbox, usually after I have sent an email. Lot's if little issues.

title: Thunderbird: switch from pop to imap
content: I am trying to switch my active and working Thunderbird 116 for Mac from pop to imap. After entering name email and password in the "set up your existing email address" I recieve the green box message indicating "the following server settings were found". When clicking the blue "done" button at the bottom of the page i get the "unable to log in to the server" error message. The mail account continues to work properly with the pop settings. Are there any workarounds or solutions to this issue? Thanks!

title: Updating shared calendar
content: I just reinstalled Thunderbird v115 on new hardware with Windows 11. I share my wife's calendar, both hers and mine are Google. I used to be able to add events to both calendars. But now I can't seem to add an event to my wife's. When I click the save and close button the window goes away but I don't see the entry. The Read only box in properties is not checked. How do I fix this?
creator: ekahan

title: Popup reminder invisible
content: I run Windows 10 Home on a PC and Thunderbird 115.9.0 (32-bit). Event and Task reminders popup OK after windows startup, but not after a second user account logs on to the PC, or Windows has run for a while. However the taskbar always indicates a reminder. It would appear that the popup is active, but the dimensions are 0 x 0 pixels. To workaround, I use Alt-Enter and Size to drag the popup window larger so that the text becomes visible.
creator: rogernathan5

title: 1. New email not bold. They used to be. 2. Sending groups of emails to trash takes much longer than before.
content: 1. The only time they are bold is if I happen to have my inbox window visible and a new message comes in. 2. In the past, I could transfer large groups of emails to the trash folder, but now, the larger the number of emails, the longer it takes. Previously, no matter how many, they would delete immediately. Trash still deletes instantly.
